intro: Pentaraphia incurva, commonly known as the zigzag rush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, zigzagging stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often forming dense colonies. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, contributing to its resemblance to other rush species.
